titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Health Systems Agency of Southwestern Pennsylvania Records, 1971-1987 AIS.1987.02
titlestmt.author: Justin Curry and David R. Grinnell.

did.unittitle: Health Systems Agency of Southwestern Pennsylvania Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Health Systems Agency of Southwestern Pennsylvania

did.abstract: The Health Systems Agency of Southwestern Pennsylvania was a health care industry coordinating organization, administered by a board made up of both health professionals and political figures. While little is known about the agency, it is clear from the records that it had a hand in directing the expansion of the health care industry in the greater Pittsburgh region during the three decades between 1960 and 1990.

physloc.emph: Due to the size and location of this collection, researchers are required to notify the Archives Service Center at least 24 hours in advance for use of this collection.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Health Systems Agency of Southwestern Pennsylvania in 1987.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Health and Welfare Federation of Allegheny County, Pittsburgh, Pa., Records 1943-1950, AIS.1968.14a, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh
Montefiore Hospital Records, 1905-1976, AIS.1981.14, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh
Visiting Nurse Association of Allegheny County Records, Inc., 1918-2000, AIS.2000.13, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Health Systems Agency of Southwestern Pennsylvania was formed during the 1960's as a coordinating body for the expanding health care industry in the greater Pittsburgh region. Officials related to the agency included health care professionals, the foundation community, and political figures. The agency worked in concert with other health care associations, including the Comprehensive Health Planning Association of Western Pennsylvania and the Hospital Planning Association. Little details are known about the mission and objectives of the organization at this time. However, by 1971 this agency became responsible for the distribution of federal funding to expand and update health care facilities and programs at hospitals, neighborhood clinics, and nursing care centers throughout southwestern Pennsylvania. Documentation on the projects that were funded through this program are the only records that are currently available for researchers to access. Each funded project has a unique identification number, beginning with number 1 and ending with project number 1601. The projects include: construction projects, purchase of new equipment, implementation of new programs, and updates to building infrastructure. The funding of projects and the demise of the Health System Agency ends in 1987.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Health Systems Agency of Southwestern Pennsylvania Records, 1971-1987, AIS.1987.02, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Health Systems Agency of Southwestern Pennsylvania Records, 1971-1987, AIS.1987.02, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Included in the records are case files for the 1601 funded projects coordinated by the Health Systems Agency of Southwestern Pennsylvania dating from 1971 to 1987. Each funded project is identified numarically, 1 thru 1601. The folder headings indicate the project number, the institution recieving the funding, and the name of the project. Project files include correspondence, proposals, financial statements, and periodic reports. A project file can consist of a single file folder of documentation or for larger project mutliple file folders.

The case files for the funded projects are the only series currently available for research. Due to the size and complexity of the entire collection of records, additional record series will be processed at a future date. Other record series will include board of directors minutes and various administrative files of the Health Systems Agency.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Justin Curry and David R. Grinnell in January-March 2013.
